metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1192 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in smb2_is_status_io_timeout() in CIFS in the Linux Kernel. After CIFS transfers response data to a system call, there are still local variable points to the memory region, and if the system call frees it faster than CIFS uses it, CIFS will access a free memory region, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic-64k - 5.15.0-83.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1044-aws - 5.15.0-1044.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1046-azure - 5.15.0-1046.53
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> this affects the KSMBD subsystem, which generally should not be used, userspace samba is the safer choice. marking the introduction of the cifsd/ksmbd config option as the break commit possible duplicate of CVE-2022-48425? The fixing commit is the same for both CVEs.

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-83.92').
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
